    • Method Detail

      • sliceNumber

        public Network sliceNumber(int numberOfSlice)
        Specifies the total number of slices the network will record.

        This is for users that want to have fixed-size information packages as this operation is really memory intensive.
        Parameters:
        numberOfSlice - the total number of slices the network will record.
        Returns:
        itself

      • graphNumber

        public Network graphNumber(int numberOfGraph)
        Specifies the total number of graph sampling events the network will do.

        This is for users that want to have fixed-size graph files.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        itself

      • id

        public Network id(int id)
        Sets this network's id for exporting the training data.

        If this method is not called then the id will be a randomly generated integer between 0 and 9999.
        Parameters:
        id - the network's intended id
        Returns:

      • miniBatch

        public Network miniBatch(Matrix lX,
                         Matrix lP,
                         int setPerBatch)
        Sets up mini-batchs.
        Parameters:
        lX - the input sample matrix
        lP - the correct output sample matrix
        setPerBatch - the number of sets in one batch. If the numbers don't divide then the last batch will have an abnormal size.
        Returns:
        itself

      • crossEntropyError

        public static float crossEntropyError(Matrix D,
                                      float lowerBound,
                                      float upperBound)
        Splits the matrix into multiple rows and calculates the average cross-entropy error of the rows.
        Parameters:
        D - the input matrix or the Delta matrix
        lowerBound - the lower bound of the activation function range
        upperBound - the upper bound of the activation function range
        Returns:
        the average cross-entropy error

      • crossEntropyError

        public float crossEntropyError(Matrix D)
        Splits the matrix into multiple rows and calculates the average cross-entropy error of the rows.
        Parameters:
        D - the input matrix or the Delta matrix
        Returns:
        the average cross-entropy error

      • error

        public float error(Matrix D)
        Calculates the cost function based on one of the existing cost functions: quadraticError(Matrix), absoluteError(Matrix) or crossEntropyError(Matrix, float, float).

        The default cost function is the quadratic cost function.
        If the network is using the cross-entropy cost function then the range of operation will be chosen automatically.
        Parameters:
        D - the input matrix or the Delta matrix
        Returns:
        the error of the matrix
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when there's a cost function it doesn't recognize
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when there's an activation family it doesn't recognize

      • quadraticError

        public float quadraticError(Matrix X,
                            Matrix P)
        Calculates the quadratic error of a sample containing 2 matrix.
        Parameters:
        X - the input sample
        P - the correct answer for that sample
        Returns:
        the quadratic error of that sample
        See Also:
        quadraticError(Matrix)

        Returns:

      • crossEntropyError

        public float crossEntropyError(Matrix X,
                               Matrix P,
                               float lowerBound,
                               float upperBound)
        Calculates the cross-entropy error of a sample containing 2 matrix.
        Parameters:
        X - the input sample
        P - the correct answer for that sample
        lowerBound - the lower bound of the activation function range
        upperBound - the upper bound of the activation function range
        Returns:
        the cross-entropy error of that sample
        See Also:
        crossEntropyError(Matrix, float, float)

      • getSlice

        @Deprecated
public processing.core.PImage getSlice(int layer)
                                             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Deprecated. 
        Gets a specified layer after being activated and scaled to the desired color range. This method is activation family dependent so don't use this on activation functions that have range other than (0, 1)
        Parameters:
        layer - the layer to sample
        Returns:
        an image of the layer
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when trying to sample a layer that doesn't exist

        Returns:
        the id of the network

      • getFrame

        public processing.core.PGraphics getFrame()
        Returns the main network's drawing frame.

        This method should never be called by methods of the same class because we are dealing with multithreading features.
        Returns:
        the main network's drawing frame

      • display

        public void display(boolean getFrame)
        Gets the frame and displays it onto the screen.

        Due to complex multithreading features, this method should only be called by the main PApplet thread or it will cause weird graphical disturbances.
        Parameters:
        getFrame - specifies whether to run getFrame() before display it or not

      • display

        public void display()
        Displays the frame onto the main sketch.

        Due to complex multithreading features, this method should only be called by the main PApplet thread or it will cause weird graphical disturbances.

      • halt

        public void halt()
        Sends a request to the network to stop training.

        Please note that the network will not immediately stop training but will stop in at most a couple of minutes.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets stuff to prepare to train another time

      • resetGraphs

        public void resetGraphs()
        Resets all the graphs

      • newSyns

        public Network newSyns(int mode,
                       float arg1,
                       float arg2)
                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Randomize the network's synapses with specified values.

        For GAUS mode, the first argument is the mean while the second is the deviation. See more at Matrix.gaussianMatrix(int, int, float, float).
        For RAND mode, the first argument is the lower bound while the second is the upper bound. See more at Matrix.randomMatrix(int, int, float, float).
        The NOIS mode hasn't been developed yet.
        Parameters:
        mode - the randomization method
        arg1 - the first argument
        arg2 - the second argument
        Returns:
        itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • newSyns

        public Network newSyns(int mode)
        Randomize the network's synapses with some default values.

        For GAUS mode, the mean is 0 while the deviation is 1.
        For RAND mode, the range is from -1 to 1.
        The NOIS mode hasn't been developed yet.
        Parameters:
        mode - the randomization method
        Returns:
        itself

      • newSyns

        public Network newSyns()
        Randomize the network's synapses using the Matrix.gaussianMatrix(int, int, float, float) method with a mean of 0 and a deviation of 0.2.
        Returns:
        itself

      • clone

        public Network clone()
        Makes a clone of the network.

        The new network will receive the same synapses and the same id.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Thread
        Returns:
        the cloned network

      • importSyns

        public Network importSyns(Matrix[] M)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Import an array of matrix into the network's synapses.
        Parameters:
        M - an array of matrix to be imported
        Returns:
        itself
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when the synapses length does not equal the array length
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when some of the synapses have a dimension different from the array

        itself

      • exportSyns

        public void exportSyns(java.lang.String file)
        Export the network's synapses as either a .synapses or a .synx file. Please visit this documentation for more information.
        Parameters:
        file - the file name to export
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when it can't recognize the extension
